S&P Global Inc. Raises Earnings Guidance for the Year 2025
data.description:
S&P Global Inc. raised earnings guidance for the year 2025. For the year, the company's full-year 2025 guidance now calls for revenue growth of 7% - 8%, GAAP diluted EPS in the range of $14.80 - $15.05. The Company is raising guidance for GAAP diluted EPS from the previous range of $14.35 - $14.60.

Other guidance metrics are unchanged from prior guidance.

data.title: Kimco Realty Corporation acquired 85% stake in Tanasbourne Village for $66 million.
data.description:
Kimco Realty Corporation (NYSE:KIM) acquired 85% stake in Tanasbourne Village for $66 million on October 30, 2025. A cash consideration of $65.9 million will be paid by Kimco Realty Corporation.

Kimco Realty Corporation (NYSE:KIM) completed the acquisition of 85% stake in Tanasbourne Village on October 30, 2025.

data.description: From August 1, 2025 to September 30, 2025, the company has repurchased 6,086,001 shares, representing 0.26% for $135 million. data.title: Baoshan Iron & Steel Co., Ltd. Reports Earnings Results for the Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Baoshan Iron & Steel Co., Ltd. reported earnings results for the nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the nine months, the company reported sales was CNY 232,436.49 million compared to CNY 242,855.68 million a year ago. Revenue was CNY 232,436.49 million compared to CNY 242,855.68 million a year ago.

Net income was CNY 7,959.43 million compared to CNY 5,882.12 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.37 compared to CNY 0.27 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.37 compared to CNY 0.27 a year ago.

data.title: Asymchem Laboratories Co., Ltd. Reports Earnings Results for the Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Asymchem Laboratories (Tianjin) Co., Ltd. reported earnings results for the nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the nine months, the company reported sales was CNY 4,629.88 million compared to CNY 4,140.29 million a year ago. Revenue was CNY 4,629.88 million compared to CNY 4,140.29 million a year ago.

data.title: Postal Savings Bank of China's Q3 Attributable Profit Rises 1.2% to 27.3 Billion Yuan, Operating Income Jumps 2.4% to 85.7 Billion Yuan
BYD's Q3 Profit Slides Over 33%
S&P Global raises annual earnings forecasts on strong bond issuance activity
data.description:
(Reuters) -S&P Global raised its annual earnings forecasts on Thursday, as robust bond issuance activity drove growth in its ratings business, sending its shares up 2.4% before the bell.

Credit spreads, a crucial gauge of the health of the corporate sector, were relatively tight in the third quarter, creating a favorable environment for bond issuance.

With corporate bond issuance strong, the September quarter rounded out to be a robust one for ratings agencies.

S&P now expects annual revenue growth of 7% to 8%, compared with its prior forecast of 5% to 7%. Annual adjusted EPS is expected in the range of $17.60 and $17.85, higher than its previous forecast of $17 and $17.25.

Revenue at S&P's ratings business jumped 12% to $1.24 billion in the three months ended September 30 from a year earlier.

Analysts expect the strong bond issuance momentum to carry forward, driven by M&A activity pickup, looming debt maturities and increasing data center funding.

Ratings agency Moody's earlier this month also raised its annual earnings forecast.

PORTFOLIO SIMPLIFICATION

S&P has also been working actively to streamline its business. The company announced in April that it would spin off its mobility business and, earlier this month, it sold its OSTTRA joint venture to asset manager KKR.

S&P announced on Thursday that it would also divest its Enterprise Data Management and thinkFolio businesses, both housed within the market intelligence division, in the coming months.

Market intelligence, S&P's biggest business, was another bright spot as its revenue jumped 6% to $1.24 billion in the third quarter.

S&P had last year rejigged the leadership team in the market intelligence business. Earlier this month, it struck a $1.8 billion deal for With Intelligence, in a move to deepen its private markets push.

Its indices arm also shone as higher market levels boosted asset-based revenues. The business reported an 11% jump in quarterly revenue.

(Reporting by Arasu Kannagi Basil in Bengaluru; Editing by Shreya Biswas)

Kimberly-Clark Corporation Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Kimberly-Clark Corporation reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 4,150 million compared to USD 4,144 million a year ago. Net income was USD 446 million compared to USD 907 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.01 compared to USD 2.43 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.01 compared to USD 2.42 a year ago. Basic earnings per share was USD 1.34 compared to USD 2.7 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share was USD 1.34 compared to USD 2.69 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 12,367 million compared to USD 12,701 million a year ago. Net income was USD 1,522 million compared to USD 2,098 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 3.74 compared to USD 5.39 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 3.73 compared to USD 5.37 a year ago. Basic earnings per share was USD 4.59 compared to USD 6.23 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share was USD 4.57 compared to USD 6.21 a year ago.

data.title: Restaurant Brands International Inc. Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Restaurant Brands International Inc. reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 1,357 million compared to USD 1,266 million a year ago. Revenue was USD 2,449 million compared to USD 2,291 million a year ago. Net income was USD 315 million compared to USD 252 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.97 compared to USD 0.79 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.96 compared to USD 0.79 a year ago. Basic earnings per share was USD 0.96 compared to USD 0.79 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share was USD 0.96 compared to USD 0.79 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 3,858 million compared to USD 3,024 million a year ago. Revenue was USD 6,968 million compared to USD 6,110 million a year ago. Net income was USD 663 million compared to USD 762 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 2.04 compared to USD 2.41 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 2.03 compared to USD 2.39 a year ago. Basic earnings per share was USD 2.03 compared to USD 2.41 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share was USD 2.01 compared to USD 2.39 a year ago.

data.title: Quanta Services, Inc. Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Quanta Services, Inc. reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 7,631.41 million compared to USD 6,493.17 million a year ago. Net income was USD 339.42 million compared to USD 293.19 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 2.28 compared to USD 1.99 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 2.24 compared to USD 1.95 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 20,637.75 million compared to USD 17,119.37 million a year ago. Net income was USD 712.93 million compared to USD 599.7 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 4.8 compared to USD 4.09 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 4.72 compared to USD 4 a year ago.
